security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill that describes a planning methodology. It contains no executable code, network calls, file system access, or other capabilities that could pose security risks. The skill is purely instructional and describes best practices for project planning.

content.user_title: Plan Projects with Research-Based Risk Mitigation
content.value_statement: Stop building on assumptions. This skill uses 6-agent research teams and 5-iteration pre-mortem analysis to create evidence-based project plans with <3% failure confidence.
actual_capabilities: Coordinates 6-agent parallel research with self-consistency validation
Generates evidence-based technology recommendations with confidence scores
Creates structured SPEC.md with complete requirements capture
Produces risk-mitigated plans with <3% failure confidence target
limitations: Requires 6-11 hours for comprehensive planning phase
Needs Claude Code with Task tool support for multi-agent coordination
Depends on available research sources for evidence quality
Pre-mortem convergence may require up to 10 iterations for complex projects

use_cases.title: Design complex distributed systems
use_cases.description: Research authentication patterns, evaluate security frameworks, and pre-mortem scalability failures before building microservices.

use_cases.title: Validate technical decisions
use_cases.description: Evidence-based technology selection with risk analysis prevents costly pivots and ensures 2-3x ROI through failure prevention.

use_cases.title: Plan compliance-critical features
use_cases.description: Comprehensive research on regulatory requirements and security standards with documented mitigation strategies for audit trails.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Project Planning
prompt_templates.prompt: I need to build a user authentication system with JWT tokens, refresh tokens, and role-based access control. The API uses Express.js and PostgreSQL. Use research-driven planning to create a comprehensive specification and risk-mitigated implementation plan.

prompt_templates.title: Complex System Architecture
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a real-time notification system that handles 1M concurrent WebSocket connections across multiple regions. Include message queuing, rate limiting, and failover strategies. Perform comprehensive research on proven patterns and pre-mortem all failure modes.

prompt_templates.title: Security-Critical Application
prompt_templates.prompt: Build a HIPAA-compliant patient data processing pipeline with end-to-end encryption, audit logging, and data anonymization. Research regulatory requirements and security best practices. Include Byzantine consensus pre-mortem for all compliance risks.

prompt_templates.title: Legacy System Migration
prompt_templates.prompt: Migrate a monolithic Java EE application to cloud-native microservices while maintaining zero downtime. Research strangler fig patterns, database migration strategies, and circuit breaker implementations. Plan for rollback scenarios and data consistency challenges.

output_examples.input: Build a payment processing API with PCI compliance
output: Research synthesis with 15+ evidence sources on payment security
Enhanced plan with 47 tasks and dependency mapping
Risk registry with 23 failure modes mitigated
Final failure confidence: 2.1% after 5 pre-mortem iterations
Planning package ready for Loop 2 implementation

best_practices: Provide detailed constraints including timeline, budget, and technical limitations to focus research effectively
Review research synthesis for confidence scores below 70% and request additional evidence for critical decisions
Iterate pre-mortem cycles if failure confidence remains above 3% after 5 iterations
anti_patterns: Skipping research phase for familiar technologies - hidden risks emerge in production
Accepting low Byzantine consensus agreement (<66%) - indicates insufficient risk analysis
Rushing through specification - incomplete requirements cause 40% of project failures

faq.question: Is this skill compatible with non-Claude Code environments?
faq.answer: No, this skill requires Claude Code's Task tool for multi-agent coordination and memory system integration.

faq.question: What happens if pre-mortem doesn't converge to <3% confidence?
faq.answer: The skill will run up to 10 iterations. If still above 3%, it provides recommendations to break down tasks further or add constraints.

faq.question: How does this integrate with existing project management tools?
faq.answer: Loop 1 outputs standard JSON planning packages and SPEC.md files that can be imported into Jira, Linear, or other tools.

faq.question: Is my project data safe during research?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill only uses public research sources and stores data locally. No proprietary information is sent to external services.

faq.question: The research phase is taking too long, how can I speed it up?
faq.answer: Use 'quick' research depth option for faster results, or provide specific technology constraints to narrow the research scope.

faq.question: How is this different from standard project planning?
faq.answer: Traditional planning relies on assumptions. This uses evidence-based research with 6-agent validation and Byzantine consensus for 85-95% failure prevention.
